title: All-Purpose Chintan
steps: Add chicken backs to fresh water in a stockpot, bring to a simmer, and skim any scum that rises, for around 5-10 minutes.
Reduce heat back down to below simmer (around 88°C/190°F), hold for 5 hours.
Add your onion and garlic. Cook for an additional hour.
Strain the soup and hold it until needed.
notes: Very similar to the doubutsu kei soup but excludes ginger and pork.
Makes this an overarchingly all-purpose soup, even in non-ramen applications.
Can be made in pressure cooker: 45 minutes at pressure (or 30 minutes with 30-minute natural release).
Can be stored for up to a week in the fridge or 6 months in the freezer.
From 'The Book of Ramen' - Chapter 2: Soup
